posts.message:
Hello there, people. I have a question regarding web development.

I've created a web application using the PHP framework CodeIgniter. Within this application, I've created a WebRTC section. What I'm asking is, is there a way to somehow allow navigation without reloading the WebRTC section?

What I've found is that we can either rewrite the entire thing as a single page app, use the HTML5 history API, or use jQuery and AJAX. Another solution off the top of my head is to use iFrames.

What I'm talking about is quite analogous to what Facebook does. You can click on the home button, and the entire page reloads, however, the chatting boxes stay in place, untouched. Can someone explain how do the Facebook guys specifically do this? Is it clean enough? Where should I start?
Google announces Android Instant Apps, use applications without installing them

Then they invented a miracle called instant applications that run in the browser, they called it Web Applications.

A Java tool created to save wasted time in converting any android layout from LTR to RTL and vice versa specially when targeting android versions below 4.2 (before RTL support)

Any contributions are most welcomed :)

Hi Geeks,
I am creating an Android application using Phonegap. It should use database of about 8000 items. it's my first time in my life to deal directly with database. So I have these problems can u give me some hints or tutorials ?
Problems :
1. How to convent an MS Access db to be used in phonegap project and which db better and easier to use in phonegap locally ?
2.  How to make a page for every item from db dynamically while I use HTML/JS only ? for example item1.html
3. how to autocomplete search input from database first column ?
4. How to dynamically link the search results to the dynamic pages created ?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CDaNGNvhMOc
